## Learning Objectives

* Be able to classify variables as either numerical or categorical.
* Identify and distinguish explanatory (predictor) and response variables.
* Identify and distinguish observational and experimental studies.
* Describe the benefits and drawbacks of common study designs.
* Describe the relationship between a sample and a population.

## Readings

* Vu, J. and Harrington, D. Introductory Statistics for the Life and Biomedical Sciences, First Edition. OpenIntro Project **Chapter 1 - Sections 1-3**

## Activities

* CFS study design activity
* Heights of Pace students study design
* Practice problems as time permits
